nodes.text: Oblique Maneuvers were Imperial Army walker formations designed to be used in conjunction with other ground assault vehicles and infantry to drive enemy forces in a desired direction. Both single and double oblique formations were used, forming diagonal lines that created a plow effect. In a double oblique formation, All Terrain Scout Transports took the forward position, allowing All Terrain Armored Transports to target enemy positions softened up by the scout walkers.
